entry.title: Anti-Terror Bill up for Duterte signature

media:group.media:title: Anti-Terror Bill up for Duterte signature
media:group.media:description: The Anti-Terrorism bill is up for President Rodrigo Duterte's signature, Malacañang confirmed Tuesday. Presidential Spokesman Harry Roque confirmed the Palace's receipt of the bill from Congress, saying it would be scrutinized before President Duterte decides on whether it should be signed into law.

entry.title: Secure accounts with Facebook's tools, privacy watchdog tells public

media:group.media:title: Secure accounts with Facebook's tools, privacy watchdog tells public
media:group.media:description: The National Privacy Commission said Tuesday social media users should activate Facebook's tools to secure their accounts while the government investigates the reported surge in dummy pages.

entry.title: PNP chief to critics of anti-terror bill: 'Hindi naman ito martial law'

media:group.media:title: PNP chief to critics of anti-terror bill: 'Hindi naman ito martial law'
media:group.media:description: Philippine National Police chief Gen. Archie Gamboa assured the public Tuesday that police will still "operate under the law" even if President Rodrigo Duterte signs the Anti-Terror bill.

entry.title: Senate version of Bayanihan 2 takes back power of purse: Hontiveros

media:group.media:title: Senate version of Bayanihan 2 takes back power of purse: Hontiveros
media:group.media:description: The Senate version of the Bayanihan Act 2 will still give President Rodrigo Duterte the power to realign funds but under very concrete and specific prescriptions, according to Senator Risa Hontiveros.

entry.title: 170,000 Quezon City students to get free gadgets for new normal | Teleradyo

media:group.media:title: 170,000 Quezon City students to get free gadgets for new normal | Teleradyo
media:group.media:description: The Quezon City government said it would provide free gadgets to about 170,000 public school students in preparation for possible online classes to keep them safe from the coronavirus pandemic.

entry.title: 2 PCG nahuling magkaangkas matapos ang duty | Teleradyo

media:group.media:title: 2 PCG nahuling magkaangkas matapos ang duty | Teleradyo
media:group.media:description:
Tiniyak ng Philippine Coast Guard na mayroon silang shuttle service para sa kanilang mga tauhan sa panahon ng pandemya matapos mag-viral sa social media ang magkaangkas nitong personnel.

entry.title: DILG says police can now give travel passes | Teleradyo

media:group.media:title: DILG says police can now give travel passes | Teleradyo
media:group.media:description:
Chiefs of police can now issue travel passes, which will cut down bureaucracy as the Philippines restarts its economy under relaxed lockdowns against the coronavirus pandemic, the interior department said Wednesday.

entry.title: 'Tatay Elmer devastated': Piston 6 counsel validating drivers' existing criminal raps | ANC

media:group.media:title: 'Tatay Elmer devastated': Piston 6 counsel validating drivers' existing criminal raps | ANC
media:group.media:description:
Two of the 6 members of PISTON transport group are facing existing criminal charges which led to their remaining in jail despite posting bail, the group's lawyer said Tuesday.
